author: rpsqrd
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------
Register a JEA endpoint that exposes VisibleFunctions on a system that has an enforced UMCI policy. Run Get-Command. Notice that not only the default 8 cmdlets are returned, but if you run `Get-Command ValidCommandName` the command is returned as expected.

JEA Session Config File:
```none
@{
SchemaVersion = '2.0.0.0'
GUID = '5b0038fa-daeb-4df2-a3aa-9c20d1ea817a'
SessionType = 'RestrictedRemoteServer'
RunAsVirtualAccount = $true
ModulesToImport = 'Hyper-V', 'ShieldedVMProvisioning', 'cimcmdlets'
VisibleFunctions = 'JeaRoles\*', 'Get-ShieldedVMProvisioningStatus', 'Initialize-ShieldedVM', 'Get-HgsClientConfiguration'
VisibleExternalCommands = 'C:\Windows\System32\whoami.exe'
}
```

```powershell
Register-PSSessionConfiguration -Name repro -Path .\jeaconfig.pssc -Force
ConvertFrom-CIPolicy -XmlFilePath "C:\Windows\schemas\CodeIntegrity\ExamplePolicies\AllowMicrosoft.xml" -BinaryFilePath "C:\Windows\System32\CodeIntegrity\SIPolicy.p7b"
Restart-Computer -Force

# After the computer restarts
Enter-PSSession . -config repro
Get-Command
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
All commands in the PSSC VisibleFunctions field are returned.

Actual behavior
---------------
Only the 8 default commands included with the RestrictedRemoteServer session type are returned.

Environment data
----------------
This was repro'd on a Windows 10 machine running RS3

```powershell
PS C:\Windows\system32> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.1.16284.1000
PSEdition                      Desktop
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   10.0.16284.1000
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
```
title: Get-Command does not return all VisibleFunctions or VisibleCmdlets in JEA sessions with UMCI enforced
